data.title: MarketWatch First Take: Apple shows its investors some love as Amazon tells them to take a seat during coronavirus
data.text: Apple Inc. and Amazon.com Inc. are taking drastically different approaches toward their investors, reflecting the separate challenges the tech giants face during the COVID-19 pandemic.

data.title: Tech expert Gene Munster reacts to Apple’s earnings
data.text: Earnings season kicked into full force Thursday as iPhone maker Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) reported fiscal second quarter results which sent shares lower by 2%.

data.title: Apple earnings released: Tim Cook has 'lots of confidence' in long term
data.text: Apple earnings were released and CEO Tim Cook said he was ‘optimistic’ about the economic recovery in the U.S.

data.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook says company saw an 'uptick across the board' in late April thanks to stimulus and work from home
data.text: Apple executives gave quite a bit of color on a call with analysts about what they've seen in the macro environment in the time of Covid-19 and how Apple has fared so far

data.title: Apple and Amazon earnings, and everything else you missed in business news today: CNBC After Hours
data.text: CNBC.com's MacKenzie Sigalos brings you the day's top business news headlines, and what to watch as the coronavirus pandemic continues to keep most of America on lockdown.

data.title: Apple Earnings Better Than Feared  'Nightmare on Elm Street Quarter,' Says Ives
data.text: Dan Ives, Wedbush analyst, discusses Apple Inc.'s earnings  on "Bloomberg Technology."

data.title: Apple’s First-Quarter Sales Are Up Despite Coronavirus Slowdown
data.text: The tech giant signaled confidence by announcing another big stock buyback, but it declined to forecast sales for the current quarter.

data.title: Apple Stores Don't Feel the Pandemic Pinch the Same Way Retail Does, Says Forrester Analyst
data.text: Julie Ask, Forrester Research analyst, discusses Apple Inc.'s earnings report on "Bloomberg Technology."

data.title: Warren Buffett’s Apple Falls as Company Skips June-Quarter Guidance
data.text: Shares of Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL), the top holding of Warren Buffett (Trades, Portfolio)’s Berkshire Hathaway Inc.

data.title: Amazon Misses on Earnings, Apple Beats but Trades Lower
data.text: Amazon came in well below earnings estimates, Apple beats on both top & bottom, plus results from Gilead, Amgen and Visa.

data.title: Loup Ventures' Gene Munster weighs in on Apple and Amazon earnings
data.text: Gene Munster discusses Amazon and Apple earnings. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Guy Adami, Tim Seymour, Karen Finerman and Dan Nathan.

data.title: Apple sales, profits exceed expectations as Chinese market brightens
data.text: Apple reported sales and profits that beat Wall Street expectations Thursday, with Chief Executive Tim Cook saying China sales were “headed in the right direction” as that country reopens from the novel coronavirus. But Cook said it was impossible to forecast overall results for the current quarter because of uncertainty created by the virus.

data.title: Apple reports earnings beat
data.text: Apple beats on the top and bottom lines, but withholds guidance.

data.title: Apple CEO Says Company Saw Pickup in April After 'Very Depressed' Period
data.text: Apple Inc. reported quarterly revenue that grew 1%, but it didn’t provide a forecast for the first time in more than a decade. Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook says Apple experienced a “very depressed” period in late March and early April, but then saw a pickup. He spoke to Bloomberg's Emily Chang on the phone. She appears on "What'd You Miss?"

data.title: Apple’s $58 Billion Quarter: iPhone Down, Mac Down, iPad down; Apple Watch Up, Services Up
data.text: Apple reported quarterly revenue of $58.3 billion today, up 1%, and income after expenses and taxes of $11.2 billion.

data.title: Apple (AAPL) Tops Q2 Earnings and Revenue Estimates
data.text: Apple (AAPL) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of 22.01% and 8.65%, respectively, for the quarter ended March 2020. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

data.title: Apple expects iPhone and wearables year-over-year revenue trends to weaken in June quarter
data.text: Apple expects year-over-year revenue performance for the iPhone and wearables segments to worsen in the June quarter relative to the March quarter, according to Chief Financial Officer Luca Maestri on the company's Thursday earnings call.

data.title: Apple says production 'was back at typical levels' toward late March
data.text: Apple Inc. AAPL, +2.11% Chief Executive Tim Cook said on the company's earnings conference call Thursday that the company saw "temporarily supply constraints" in February due to the pandemic but that production "was back at typical levels toward the end of March.

data.title: Apple News hits 125 million monthly active users
data.text: During the pandemic crisis, active users of Apple’s news platform hit an all-time high. On an earnings call, Apple CEO Tim Cook shared that Apple News had reached 125 million monthly active users.

data.title: Apple ekes out 1% growth despite virus in March quarter
data.text:
The effects of the virus outside China only began hurting Apple’s business in the final two weeks.
Apple reported a year-over-year growth of 1% in the first quarter of the year as the coronavirus pandemic descended.

data.title: Apple EPS beats, $2.55 vs. $2.26 estimated
data.text: CNBC's Josh Lipton reports quarterly earnings from Apple.

data.title: iPhone sales are down, ahead of uncertain times for the industry
data.text: Stop me if you’ve heard this one before: Apple device sales have taken a hit, but the company’s services are doing swell. The iPhone, the longtime cornerstone of the company’s hardware portfolio hit $28.96 billion in revenue for Q2, down from $31.1 billion from this time last year.

data.title: Apple sales inch higher despite coronavirus but CEO Tim Cook sees uncertain future
data.text: Apple Inc  reported sales and profits that beat Wall Street expectations Thursday, with Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook saying China sales were "headed in the right direction" as that country reopens from the novel coronavirus.

data.title: Dan Ives: 'This is a small victory in a dark environment' on Apple Q2 earnings
data.text: Dan Ives, Wedbush managing director and Ross Gerber, Gerber Kawasaki CEO, join "Closing Bell" to discuss Apple's second quarter earnings and revenue.

data.title: Stephanie Link on tech stocks: Key is supply chain
data.text: Stephanie Link, CNBC Contributor, joins "Closing Bell" to discuss the markets.

data.title: Apple’s Stock Falls After iPhone Sales Plunge Amid Coronavirus
data.text: Services revenue continued to show strong growth while iPhone sales slowed.

data.title: Apple sales beat expectations but Tim Cook sees uncertainty ahead
data.text: Company reports $58.3bn in sales as CEO says China sales ‘headed in the right direction’ despite coronavirus

data.title: Apple sales, earnings grow even as coronavirus weighs on iPhone
data.text: The tech giant said accessories and services resonated with customers stuck at home, but didn't offer guidance about the future, indicating it still doesn't know COVID-19's impact.

data.title: Apple Earnings: AAPL Stock Dips 1% Despite Q2 Beat
data.text:
Apple (AAPL) earnings for the tech company's fiscal second quarter of 2020 have AAPL stock heading lower after-hours Thursday.
The post Apple Earnings: AAPL Stock Dips 1% Despite Q2 Beat appeared first on InvestorPlace.

data.title: Does Apple Deserve More Credit For Q2 Earnings?
data.text: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) released its most recent quarterly results after markets closed Thursday.

data.title: Apple Beats March-Quarter Targets Despite Coronavirus Headwinds
data.text: Consumer electronics behemoth Apple late Thursday beat Wall Street's targets for its coronavirus-impacted March quarter. The Apple earnings report caused AAPL stock to waver in late trades.

data.title: Apple revenue picks up slightly amid coronavirus
data.text: Apple warned earlier this year that it would experience a slump in iPhone sales as the coronavirus upends its supply chain and its biggest markets. But so far the impact appears muted.

data.title: Apple’s Q2 earnings show flat year-over-year revenue growth due to pandemic
data.text: Apple delivered a rough Q2 earnings report Thursday, besting investor expectations but showing a significant growth slowdown as the coronavirus pandemic deeply impacted the company’s business. Apple’s stock was largely unchanged in after-hours trading.

data.title: Apple now has $192.8 billion in cash on hand, down from last quarter
data.text: Apple has continuously hosted one of the largest cash piles among U.S. companies, but is facing pressure from the Covid-19 pandemic.

data.title: Apple Reports Big Q2 Earnings Beat, Driven By Record Services Revenue
data.text: Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) reported quarterly earnings of $2.55 per share on Thursday, which beat the analyst consensus estimate of $2.26 by 12.83%.

data.title: Apple reports higher sales as China reopens after coronavirus but gives no forecast
data.text: Apple Inc  reported sales and profits that beat Wall Street expectations Thursday, with Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook saying China sales were "headed in the right direction" as that country reopens from the novel coronavirus.

data.title: Apple Quarterly Revenue, Profit Beats Wall Street Estimates, Stock Pops
data.text: Apple reported earnings $58.3 billion in revenue last quarter and $2.55 earnings per share, beating expectations on both fronts. Sales were up 1% and profit up 4% from the year earlier quarter. Wall Street’s revenue consensus was about $54.6 billion but the estimates varied dramatically given the uncertainties. Consensus profit forecast was $2.27 a share,

data.title: Global lockdowns take bite out of Apple iPhone sales
data.text: Apple has reported a hit to key iPhone sales as coronavirus lockdowns, beginning in China, forced stores to close.

data.title: What to look for with Apple set to report earnings after the bell
data.text: Apple's stores around the world, except in China and one location in Korea, are shuttered until further notice.

data.title: This level 'would be the all clear' for Apple's stock as iPhone maker heads into earnings: Chart analyst
data.text: As Apple prepares to report earnings after Thursday's closing bell, Todd Gordon of Ascent Wealth Partners is watching one key level on its chart for an "all clear."

data.title: Apple stock options pricing in a tamer-than-usual earnings report
data.text: While investors prep for the unknown from Apple Inc. AAPL, +1.32% , ahead of the technology behemoth's COVID-19-tainted fiscal second-quarter results after Thursday's closing bell, options traders are pricing in a less volatile than reaction.

data.title: Apple And Google Launch First Phase Of COVID-19 Contact Tracing. Will Americans Use It?
data.text: A new survey conducted by The Washington Post and the University of Maryland found that a small majority Americans aren’t planning on using the apps, with nearly 3 in 5 Americans are either unwilling or unable to use the infection-alert system that Google and Apple have developed.

data.title: Big Tech Earnings Off To A Running Start
data.text: Tech firms that rely on revenue from engagement and cloud computing are driving pandemic immunity that has propelled the tech sector so far this year

data.title: With new coronavirus tracker, Apple and Google may finally get their big break in health care
data.text: For years, Apple and Google have dreamed of breaking into the enormous market for personal health. Apple CEO Tim Cook has said he wants health tech to be considered Apple's "greatest contribution" to humanity, and sought clearance from the Food and Drug Administration so that the latest Apple Watches can monitor your heart rhythm. Google has poured hundreds of millions into research on aging, cancer and neuroscience. Both have acquired health startups, and poached health executives.

data.title: Is Apple Poised to Impress With Q2?
data.text: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) is scheduled to release its fiscal second-quarter financial results after the markets close on Tuesday.

data.title: Never Count Apple Stock Out, Even While It’s in a Storm
data.text:
Apple stock has the legs to outlast this pandemic with its strong potential in the latter half of the year.
The post Never Count Apple Stock Out, Even While It’s in a Storm appeared first on InvestorPlace.

data.title: 3 Top Value Stocks to Buy Right Now: AAPL, LVS & VZ
data.text: There are still some big values on the stock market today.

data.title: Facebook, Google And The Rest Of Big Tech Have Too Much Influence? Hardly
data.text: Amazon, Apple, Alphabet, Facebook, and Microsoft are far from perfect, but the reality is that they will only grow in stature in the months and years to come. And that could be a better outcome than many are willing to acknowledge.

data.title: Apple And Amazon Right Ahead: Busy Earnings Day Caps A Month Of Historic Strength
data.text: Today is the busiest earnings day of the busiest earnings week of the quarter. It’s also the last day of a historic month that saw stocks rally the most of any month since 1974.
